column5: No studs for me this year. Highways were clear all winter minus maybe 4 days, in which case I just drove local

It's a mess out here today. Kohler Rd and Fisherville have 2 foot plus drifts and now freezing slush across them. 8" of snow at least came off the lake last night now it's -7C and the wind is picking up from the NW. I see my wife took the 4X4 truck when I woke up. She's getting smarter, I just filled it up yesterday. I was going to switch over tires yesterday, not yet.
Lmao nice
Now if you had described my vehicle (caravan) I probably wouldn't have been so quick to jump on that... NAH! I'd still do it!  Michael
Well ten days ago when I started this thread this was NOT in the 14 day forecast. Glad I did nothing and I  would never say "i told you so", but some would lol
So happy that I haven't switched mine yet! Kinda of knew that we'd have this kind of spring!
Didn't do it yesterday with my latest service visit and was glad this morning. Found some black ice on the road and almost slid right through a stop sign even with the winter tires.

Black ice? Racist lol j/k.  It was plus 15 here, all snow gone.  Then we get 30 cm and freezing temps.  Had to run in 30 mins to get baby formula and it was a complete gong show.  Im in a jeep liberty, the slush was nasty. Seen 6 vehicles in the ditch.  I had no winters on but burned some gas in 4wd.  Brutal
Black ice? Racist lol j/k. lol. You made me think of that Key and Peele sketch about black ice/white snow.
Just for the heck, I called my insurance and they said they have no firm dates for installation or removal of winter tires.
Mine is dec. 15 to april 1st.  S.
Mandatory in QC until Apr 15 but my summers are snow-flake rated (Wrangler Duratracs) so I'll put them on once this little cold break passes thru.

Keep the snows on everyone , a storm has its sights set on us here in Ontario for Wed/Thurs . Still a little early for forecasting but central Ontario could get up to 20 cm before it changes over to rain Friday . As a general rule in my house and livin in the snow belt , the snows don't come off till the "Masters Weekend" Which is the second week of April . Forgot to mention that the GTA area could get a bit of freezing rain along with the snow with this system !

I'm glad mine are still on...went for an oil change today and thought of getting them changed at the same time....from when I went ti when I got out we got 3" of snow and you can't see anything right now...out like a Lion I guess
An icy slippery mess here. Glad mine are still on too.
Mine are off so I stayed home today....HELLLLLLOOOOO extra long weekend!!!
20-30 cm coming today...This weekend and early into next week will be the last of the prime sledding, ice fishing season.  Will start to get patchy by next weekend I'd guess.
Mine are off so I stayed home today....HELLLLLLOOOOO extra long weekend!!! I got the email telling everyone to stay home this morning about half an hour after I got to work...
Well ten days ago when I started this thread this was NOT in the 14 day forecast. Glad I did nothing
I was thankful my boss had a brain and decided to keep me semi local rather than sending me to orillia today lol, roads to Mississauga were not bad at all at 5am though.

I was thankful my boss had a brain and decided to keep me semi local rather than sending me to orillia today lol, roads to Mississauga were not bad at all at 5am though.  Ya good thing. We dont need you citites up here causing accidents. W ehave enough newbies up here to take care of that.
Yup I always keep my on til April, just in case we have what happened over the last 24 hours happen.
left at my normal time was still first one to work at 715 drive from Lindsay to Oshawa not that bad and the duratracs stuck to the road

Haha funny you say that.. Dunno if it was cause I was driving a Chevy or something but turning left at atherly onto 12 I was on the inside lane (of 2) and the outside one merges quickly but some dude in a ford pinned it around the corner and cut me off HARD braked extremely hard and then decided to wave back at me like "haha I beat you"  Just had to shake my head, older guy too

Haha funny you say that.. Dunno if it was cause I was driving a Chevy or something but turning left at atherly onto 12 I was on the inside lane (of 2) and the outside one merges quickly but some dude in a ford pinned it around the corner and cut me off HARD braked extremely hard and then decided to wave back at me like "haha I beat you"  Just had to shake my head, older guy too  Ah yes, the racer in all of us.LOL Know that intersection well. I beat most of them off the outside lane. LOL
Just had to shake my head, older guy too  He used to be young and stupid, but now he's old!
well I'm glad I held off swapping over lol  It's not an insane amount of snow in the GTA but enough to make it interesting. Looks like middle of the month before I get around to it.
Crazy easter  weekend  meant I didn't switch either vehicle. Just made it through before the big accident on the 400 yesterday.

Haha funny you say that.. Dunno if it was cause I was driving a Chevy or something but turning left at atherly onto 12 I was on the inside lane (of 2) and the outside one merges quickly but some dude in a ford pinned it around the corner and cut me off HARD braked extremely hard and then decided to wave back at me like "haha I beat you"  Just had to shake my head, older guy too Kept mine on so I could get around all the out of towners turning left off atherly onto to 12, cut 'em off and wave at 'em! (brian will confirm I'm just kiddin' whicha!)  Michael
Blizzaks are still on doing their job quite well.

I bought my first set of winter tires (Hankooks) in early December, just switched over to my all season tires last Wednesday.  Woke up today to 4" of new snow.  Doesn't matter, I don't plan on going out today.  It's all gonna melt on Wednesday +6 C.
ya there is no crowd in my garage! timing is my problem. If I dont getter done this week not sure when I will.
I took a chance this year and never even put them on. Worked out well for me

I normally wait too but I changed my truck tires this weekend in anticipation of a trip or two to Detroit in the next week...  It feels like you just took off a pair of  rubber boots and slipped on some running shoes the first trip down the road!  I do love the snows when it's slippery out but those summer tires sure do drive a lot nicer on the highway.  Edit:  I kind of forgot about the insurance thing and just checked, I was supposed to leave the snows on until April....DOH!
This ^  My insurance says april. I also get a 5% reduction for snows.  S.
Yep, just got an email back. Mine must be on until March 31st. Can change them April 1st. If they are not on in an accident or claim they have an avenue to deny the claim.
With your drive Wayne, you need them til it dries out. That mud is worst then the snow.LOL

We are already changing lots back to all season...it's not the air temps that kill winter tires it's the temp of the pavement. Unless your policy has specific clauses I'm not sure how they can deny a claim? Having said that March 31- April 15 is typical..

From this chart, it looks like the majority of the policies require their use until the end of March but some are different as are the discount percentages and the parts of the policies the discounts apply to:  http://www.ggninsurance.ca/uploads/7/6/4/9/7649154/carrier_summary_-_winter_tire_disc_pdff.pdf

Mentioned to the guy when I called for a service appointment today that I was thinking about it. I'd be the first this year apparently. I waited until mid December to put them on too. I'll see if I'm in the mood to lug them into the car that morning. It only takes me about an hour to switch them out, and they're calling for snow this weekend so I'm thinking probably wait until April. But I am chronically lazy so if I can save myself that hour in a months time I might do it anyway lol.
Lol

ok...convinced. Insurance was the big factor, hadn't thought about that. Also, when I looked at the long-term forecast there were still quite a few subzero nights coming up....that could mean snow on the morning drive into work. Gonna hold off, do it in a couple weeks. Plus it means I can procrastinate today, have a beer, and not lug the tires out. Gonna go grab that beverage
LOL "To Monday" Roger !
Gonna go grab that beverage  I'll drink to that brother!  I'm thinking I better go home and put the rubber boot snows back on the truck....

I looked at the specs for my winter tires and it says they should be off when temps average 15C. I had a set of Blizzacs that came with a car I bought and didn't know or care to know they were winter tires. They lasted until mid June before a belt ripped off the tire. Lucky I was only going around 20K making a turn.  A question I have had in the past is what to do when driving to Florida in the winter every year when we had the family condo there? I would drive the car down and leave it there for Mom and Dad and fly back. I have had some pretty bad weather all the way to Georgia. Once in Florida if we left with winter tires on they would be unsafe in no time, if I had all seasons on in some really bad weather that haven't be very good either. Solution, I bought a mint 85' Buick for $750.00 and left it there for my family. Ah the good old days. Now it's the cold new days.
Starting Friday we're gonna a few -10 or colder nights in a row, so the winters stay on until the end of the month.
So, for a 5% discount, the insurance company gets an avenue to possibly deny a claim when you really need them? Screw that. If they offer something, it's because it's to their benefit.

So, for a 5% discount, the insurance company gets an avenue to possibly deny a claim when you really need them? Screw that. If they offer something, it's because it's to their benefit.  They offered it because the provincial government told them they had to......
50 bucks Chris.. case and a half of beer! If you're running dedicated snows you may as well take them up on what the government made them offer.

So, for a 5% discount, the insurance company gets an avenue to possibly deny a claim when you really need them? Screw that. If they offer something, it's because it's to their benefit.  Funny Chris I said pretty much exactly the same thing ..word for word...an hour ago while discussing this in the car with Debbe  50 bucks Chris.. case and a half of beer! If you're running dedicated snows you may as well take them up on what the government made them offer. Wait a minute....50 bucks...thats almost 4 bottles of the bosses favourite red wine.
Nope. I would eat the 50 bucks and not give them the avenue to bail out on a big claim.

Its not a big deal if you run snows. I swear by them and find them to be helpful in the spring when back roads are mush. I do a lot of driving in bad conditions and find they are worth the prixe in piece of mind anyways. 5000km/ month on average and i dont let bad weather stop me from doing what i have to do.  S.

I have a daily 200k commute so two years ago I thought I should get snows for the safety and insurance savings. I forgot how much better they grip in snow and now would never drive a winter without them.

Yep, just got an email back. Mine must be on until March 31st. Can change them April 1st. If they are not on in an accident or claim they have an avenue to deny the claim. They can't deny a claim because you don't have snows on, the worst they could do is remove the discount.  In most cases it's just a guideline, and this year common sense may be to have them off earlier.

They can deny or at least try to get out of a claim if you're driving on bald tires, can't see it being any different not having snows on that are listed as required on your policy. Similar to the "lay up" period on most of our boat policies, it's what you agreed on to get the price reduction.
I'm with you Irish, 50 bucks gets me 2 nice steaks at the butchers.  As Yogi Berra said about insurance " You don't need it when ya got it and you don't got it when ya need it."

I have a couple days off work....strongly considering swapping out the tires on both vehicles in the next day or two. Anyone else thinking of making the change early or am I alone in considering doing this? The 2 week forecast was all above zero (and many days above 7)
no  we will have at least one more good storm and - temps in the mornings  but don't quote me on that
Lemme check with the ground hog and/or farmers almanac.!
2nd or 3rd week in April for me. Have gone flying on a fresh dump of snow as late as April 10th before.
I got a flat a couple weeks ago and tossed my all seasons on then, got through those last couple blasts just fine but my car is also front wheel, so that helps a lot.
One vehicle will get switched soon. I usually leave one a little longer just incase. But in the balmy south where you are I'd be switching them out for sure.

I have a couple days off work....strongly considering swapping out the tires on both vehicles in the next day or two. Anyone else thinking of making the change early or am I alone in considering doing this? The 2 week forecast was all above zero (and many days above 7) I am considering as well but knowing how inconsistent the weather is, I would not be surprised be if we get another dumping of snow in the first week of April  .
usually wait till 2nd week of april myself
I'm holding of until the first week of April.

My insurance company wants me to keep them on till may, I getting a huge $4.12 discount a month for having them on. But I don't think they will see April. Not gonna burn up my new snows for $4 a month

I have a veggie garden here in Courtice  that I try to get into as early as possible. I could have tilled it this weekend if I wasn't so busy.  Most years I have stuff planted in March.  Where I'm going with this is almost every year we seem to get one last substantial dumping of snow towards the end of March. It used to drive me crazy because I'd be all worried if my early planted stuff would survive....but it always has so I don't worry anymore. But for this reason alone I will leave my snows on until April.

Reminds me Bondar.. I'd better look at my policy as I got a similar HUGE reduction for dedicated snows. If you get in an accident and the snows aren't on during the "required period" bet your bottom dollar that you're outta luck !
They stay on until my first round of Golf.

My insurance company wants me to keep them on till may, I getting a huge $4.12 discount a month for having them on. But I don't think they will see April. Not gonna burn up my new snows for $4 a month I am with Belair Direct and they require winter tires for the discount from Dec 15 to march 15. Pretty good policy for winters like the one we just had.
never thought about the insurance! They would use any loophole not to have to pay.

its just that last fall I finally got a proper jack, and yesterday I finally bought an impact gun,,,no more stomping on the tire iron and using the crappy jack in the trunk for me. I am actually looking forward to changing them. Gonna be a breeze this time. Used to take me an hour per car, now I bet both are done in an hour.
Yeah I debated it too... but decided to wait another few weeks just in case.

I wouldn't.  Better to be safe than sorry.  I have a couple days off work....strongly considering swapping out the tires on both vehicles in the next day or two. Anyone else thinking of making the change early or am I alone in considering doing this? The 2 week forecast was all above zero (and many days above 7)
had the jeep in for brakes this week and figured i may as well swap the all terrains on.  not to worried about a late snowfall in that vehicle though.

its just that last fall I finally got a proper jack, and yesterday I finally bought an impact gun,,,no more stomping on the tire iron and using the crappy jack in the trunk for me. I am actually looking forward to changing them. Gonna be a breeze this time. Used to take me an hour per car, now I bet both are done in an hour.  now u just need a torque wrench
Switching to the all seasons this week... If we do get snow... Which I doubt... All seasons are fine...  Winters are too soft... I don't wanna wear em out in this +10-15 weather we are getting
I never even put mine on either vehicle this year lol.  Just wasnt needed. Highways were bare all winter.  Heck it rained all day today, no more snow on the ground at all
I took mine off. Had a cracked rim on one of my snows.

I live in southern ontario and knew we wouldn't need them because of El Nino. Last year was the last year we will ever need snow tires. See graph http://www.wunderground.com/blog/JeffMasters/february-smashes-earths-alltime-global-heat-record-by-a-jawdropping

I'll be changing my truck tires today I hope, but I'm switching from studded winters to my summer All-Terrains (snow rated too), so it's not a big deal to have it done early. At least I'll beat the crowds.
